And because the "norm" is seen to be "better" then clearly I need help (ableist fallacy).

5/

text: @StructuredSucc I personally prefer describing ADHD as neurodiversity. While certain traits may prevent you from mastering certain skills, other traits may enhance your ability to master some other things. For instance, struggling with instructions but finding an equally valid solution instead.

text: @_cxpcxke @GHOSTRULlNG ptsd isnt inherent neurodiversity, but it doesnt make you neurotypical. ppl who arent neurodivergent but have mental illnesses (especially judgement altering ones like PTSD) are considered neuroatypical. PTSD is related to psychological development, not neurological development.

text: For me it’s more a matter of neurodiversity than introversion. I love living in a big city and having people nearby. But I need my own space. Having control over my environment, routines, and sensory inputs — and not having to be in constant people-ing mode — keeps me functional.

text:
INFOTWEET

Groups of people are neurodiverse.

Individuals are either neurotypical or neurodivergent.

Neurodiversity includes everyone.

Neurodivergency includes only neurodivergent people.

There are many neurodivergencies - eg. autism, dyslexia, ADHD.

- What do you think of Neurodiversity?
- What do you think of ABA? 1/2

text:
@alyzande @Fiona_Clarke_ One single animal can’t be biodiverse it’s part of biodiversity

A group of animals of different types (plants etc) can be biodiverse

One single person can’t be neurodiverse but are part of Neurodiversity

A group of people can be neurodiverse

#Neurodiversity #Neurodivergence

- exhaustion

- pain
- etc & etc!

You may have noticed we use the term Neurodiversity.

text:
If this helps someone, or a teacher:

Having breaks in Zoom meetings throughout the day is *super* hard for kids with neurodiversity and PTSD.  It’s hard for them to transition from meeting to meeting, as opposed to having one long Zoom meeting, which is less transition-laden.

text: @LeaC_Official @wakeman1991 @blytheandferb21 @CStephens2001 Julia’s the best autistic character I’ve ever seen in my life and it really breaks my heart knowing Sesame Workshop chose Autism $peaks over ASAN to partner with in the name of neurodiversity.  Good news is, if enough folks make enough calls, we can see a change for the better.

text: Yes yes yes to everything here. We view neurodiversity from a neurotypical lens - making it a “disability” rather than a different way of viewing the world. False stereotypes prevail, marginalising amazing individuals on the spectrum. Let’s change in our discourse around ASD! https://t.co/o6Bo1s36xo

text: I do think that where neurodiversity is concerned we do need to wary of erasing all the differences across the spectrum because the accessibility/support needs we have can be quite different but generally speaking I think we have more in common going on in our internal world

text:
Also, on the flip side, don't be an ass to others and use your neurodiversity as a reason 'you just can't help it, that is the way I am'.

Neurodiversity doesn't give you a pass on being a bully, any more than it gives others a pass to bully you.

text: @ClishemMike @NadiaWhittomeMP @paulmasonnews Yes, but that's the point!! text: When a suffocating system is sitting on your chest (oppression) it sometimes crushes you, and you are likely to break into many small pieces.  So you can mentally break, but it's often (likely) a result of the system.  It's not something you welcomed by design.  #Neurodiversity

text: At NOMADS United, we support neurodivergence.  Difference, not disability.  That doesn't mean many ND people aren't broken.  For many, it's trauma from the innumerable daily micro aggressions and abuses for challenging the status quo (via creativity).   #Neurodiversity

text: In fact, most of the "successful" (esp history making) remain with a feeling of being outsiders and will tell you so in private conversation.  And for those who do not navigate the many, many barriers to opportunity ... well, life can be very bleak.  #Neurodiversity

text: For many NDs, our lived experience is that of an outsider.  We suffer in many ways, much of the time.  Social, economic and civic exclusion because we don't fit in the box of social order and replication. #Neurodiversity

text: Many may see us a pathological diagnosis, disorder or dysfunction.  A medical deficit.  This thinking has been entrenched throughout much of agrarian history.  #neurodiversity

text: More than this, we are also victims of systemic discrimination.  A term we are becoming more familiar with these days.  It was always there, just never revealed until dark days tested our humanity as a whole and silenced the noise around us.  #Neurodiversity

broken

text: @jus_de_citron05 @WyrdWombman There’s often an overlap between different types of neurodiversity. So whilst some children with autism may also have coordination difficulties, autism is not a coordination disorder. It’s a difference in brain structure that primary affects a child’s social communication skills.
